hexagon.hexagon_grid module

hexagon.hexagon_grid.array_indexes_from_hex_coordinates(q: int, r: int, min_q: int, min_r: int) → tuple[int, int]

Map hexagon’s coordinates to indexes of a 0-indexed array :param q: first hexagonal coordinate :type q: int :param r: second hexagonal coordinate :type r: int :param min_q: min of q in the hexagonal grid :type min_q: int :param min_r: min of r in the hexagonal grid :type min_r: int

Returns:

array coordinates (i,j)

Return type:

tuple[int, int]

hexagon.hexagon_grid.axial_round(q: float, r: float) → tuple[int, int]

Round the axial coordinates to the nearest hexagon :param q: first axial coordinate :type q: float :param r: second axial coordinate :type r: float

Returns:

axial coordinates of the nearest hexagon

Return type:

tuple[int, int]

hexagon.hexagon_grid.axial_to_cube(q: float | int, r: float | int) → tuple[float, float] | tuple[int, int]

Converts axial coordinates to cube coordinates :param q: first axial coordinate :type q: float | int :param r: second axial coordinate :type r: float | int

Returns:

cube coordinates

Return type:

tuple[float, float] | tuple[int, int]

hexagon.hexagon_grid.corners_from_hex_coordinates(q: float, r: float, size: int) → list[int]

Compute the pixel coordinates of the corners of the hexagon with coordinates (q,r) :param q: first axial coordinate :type q: float :param r: second axial coordinate :type r: float :param size: external radius of one hexagon in pixel :type size: int

Returns:

pixel coordinates of each corner of the hexagon

Return type:

list[int]

hexagon.hexagon_grid.cube_round(q_float: float, r_float: float, s_float: float) → tuple[int, int, int]

Rounds cube coordinates to the nearest hexagon :param q_float: first cube coordinate :type q_float: float :param r_float: second cube coordinate :type r_float: float :param s_float: third cube coordinate :type s_float: float

Returns:

cube coordinates rounded to the nearest hexagon

Return type:

tuple[int, int, int]

hexagon.hexagon_grid.flat_hex_to_pixel(q: float, r: float, size: int) → tuple[float, float]

Converts hexagonal coordinates (flat hexagon grid) to pixel coordinates :param q: first hexagonal axis coordinate :type q: float :param r: second hexagonal axis coordinate :type r: float :param size: external radius of one hexagon in pixel :type size: int

Returns:

pixel coordinates of the center of the hexagon with hex coordinates (q,r)

Return type:

tuple[float, float]

hexagon.hexagon_grid.hex_coordinates_from_array_indexes(i: int, j: int, min_q: int, min_r: int) → tuple[int, int]

Map array indexes to the corresponding hexagonal coordinates with respect to the problem specific hexagonal grid in use :param i: first dimension index :type i: int :param j: second dimension index :type j: int :param min_q: min of q in the hexagonal grid :type min_q: int :param min_r: min of r in the hexagonal grid :type min_r: int

Returns:

hexagonal coordinates (q,r)

Return type:

tuple[int, int]

hexagon.hexagon_grid.map_value_from_ab_to_xy(value: float, a: float, b: float, x: float, y: float) → float

Maps a value from a source range [a,b] to a target range [x,y] :param value: The value to map :type value: float :param a: Lower bound of the source range :type a: float :param b: Higher bound of the target range :type b: float :param x: Lower bound of the target range :type x: float :param y: Higher bound of the target range :type y: float

Returns:

the value of “value” mapped from [a,b] to [x,y]

Return type:

float

hexagon.hexagon_grid.pixel_to_flat_hex(x: int, y: int, size: int) → tuple[int, int]

hexagonal coordinates (q,r)
